icontrol.drivers.instruments.cryomagnetics

Class LM500

  • java.lang.Object
    • icontrol.drivers.Device
      • icontrol.drivers.instruments.cryomagnetics.LM500

  • @iC_Annotation(CommPorts=RS232,
               InstrumentClassName="Cryomagnetics LM 500")
public class LM500
extends Device
    This class implements functionality to communicate with a Cryomagnetics LM-500 Liquid Cryogen Level Monitor.

    Instrument Commands:

    • Measure(int)
    • #Refill(float)

    Some peculiarities of this Instrument-Class:

    • The LM-500 echoes all RS232 commands, hence, the SendToInstrument and QueryInstrument methods have been overridden.

    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    KPP (Kurt Pernstich: pernstich@alumni.ethz.ch)

    • Method Detail

      • SendToInstrument

        public void SendToInstrument(java.lang.String Message)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Overridden SendToInstrument method that reads back the echoed response of the LM-500. It compares the response to the send one and throws an Exception if they are different to indicate a transmission error. The Message to be sent is appended with a \r (RETURN) to "execute" the command on the LM-500.
        Overrides:
        SendToInstrument in class Device
        Parameters:
        Message - that will be logged and sent to the Instrument, appended with a \r (return).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the transmission caused a communication error; can bubble up from the RS232 driver, or when the echoed response is not identical to Message

      • QueryInstrument

        protected java.lang.String QueryInstrument(java.lang.String Message)
                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Overridden QueryInstrument method which sends a string via the chosen communication port (which is RS232) to the Instrument (a \r is added before sending to "execute" the command at the LM-500), and reads the Instrument's reply. The reply contains the echoed Message and it is stripped off before returning.

        Note that if Message contains characters with a special meaning for Regex (?, \, $, ^, ...), this method needs to be adapted because, as of now, only the ? is handled appropriately when stripping off the echoed response.

        Overrides:
        QueryInstrument in class Device
        Parameters:
        Message - is sent via RS232 with an appended \r (RETURN).
        Returns:
        Returns the string read from the instrument where the echoed Message has been stripped off, or an empty String if in No-Communication-Mode.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the transmission caused a communication error; bubbles up from the RS232 driver or if the response did not contain the echoed Message, hence, a transmission error occurred.

      • Measure

                   ParameterNames="Channel {1 or 2}",
                   DefaultValues="1",

        Returns the last measurement of the cryogen level of the selected channel.

        Returns:

      • Refill

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="Starts Auto-Refill if measured cryogen level is below a threshold.",
                   ParameterNames={"Channel {1 or 2}","Threshold level"},
                   DefaultValues={"2","40"},
                   ToolTips={"","in display units, e.g. %"})
 @iC_Annotation(MethodChecksSyntax=true)
public void Refill(int Channel,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            double ThresholdLevel)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            java.util.zip.DataFormatException
        Measures the current cryogen level of the specified channel and compares with ThresholdLevel. If the cryogen level is below ThresholdLevel Auto-Refilling is started. When Auto-Refilling is started, this method waits a time specified in the iC.properties (180 sec) after starting the refill and before returning. If the current cryogen level cannot be measured, a notification is shown to the user but processing of the script continues.
        Parameters:
        Channel - The channel which should be measured; can be 1 or 2
        ThresholdLevel - If the cryogen level of channel Channel is below Level, Auto-Refilling is started
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Bubbles up from SendToInstrument or from QueryInstrument
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException - When the Syntax-check fails
